passage_text: Wayne State students are assessed tuition each semester based on their residency, credit hours, year in school, division status, academic program, and school or college. See the Tuition and Fee Schedule (PDF) for detailed tuition information.

Scholarships. Wayne State offers more than 200 scholarships and awards more than $1.5 million in scholarships each year. New, transfer and current students are eligible for scholarships based on academic ability, field of study, leadership ability and a variety of other criteria.

Undergraduate Tuition. Wayne State University tuition is $10,094 per year for in-state residents. This is 57% more expensive than the national average public four year tuition of $6,429. The cost is $7,174 and 42% cheaper than the average Michigan tuition of $17,268 for 4 year colleges. Tuition ranks 16th in Michigan amongst 4 year colleges for affordability and is the 51st most expensive 4 year college in the state.

Tuition and fees at Wayne State College are determined by several factors (i.e.): 1  number of credit hours the student is enrolled in. 2  the student’s residency status. 3  location/instruction mode. 4  on-campus, off-campus, or online. 5  the course level. 6  courses numbered 100-499 will be charged at the undergraduate rate.
